channel.title: How To Increase Torrent Speed?
channel.description: I'm downloading MS Office because I need Word for my coursework. I'm download at about 6Kb/s which is pretty poor. My internet should be downloading torrents at about 30-40Kb/s, maybe even a bit more. Anyway I can increase the speed?

item.title: How To Increase Torrent Speed?
item.dc:creator: @Aftermath_961 Aftermath
item.description:
@Aftermath_961 wrote:

And they would sell it to someone else, essentially making them the demon.

Read full topic

item.title: How To Increase Torrent Speed?
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:21, topic:86202”][quote author=Javacisnotrecognized link=topic=126505.msg1233975#msg1233975 date=1177824196]
Do you honestly believe that? Considering he’s the richest man on Earth and made the modern computer?
[/quote]

He may be the richest man on earth, but he most certainly did not make the modern computer. He is nothing but a (very) good business man, he even bought DOS off of another guy. :)[/quote]

I agree with you Mopar. And also, if he didn’t buy DOS, which was how he got the monopoly, there would be no way Microsoft would be what it is today. If Microsoft was around if they didn’t buy DOS and they had their own OS, then it would be very very good to be able to compete with Apple. I wish I could go back in time and tell IBM not to sell it to that demon lol.

Read full topic

item.title: How To Increase Torrent Speed?
item.dc:creator: @Hiaburi Hiaburi
item.description:
@Hiaburi wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:25, topic:86202”]I don’t recommend uTorrent, they sold out to RIAA friendly Bittorrent and the client is staying closed source. What does that mean? Potentially they could put some code in there that reports you to RIAA or a government agency if you are downloading illegal torrents, and you wouldn’t be able to tell because it is closed source. Your best bet it to stick with open source bittorrent clients to be 100% sure of your safety.

I recommend:

Azureus (Java, cross-platform)
KTorrent (Linux, KDE)[/quote]

Oh shit… i need to wipe my pc again, thats jsut what i need, $15k+ in fines for bootlegged shat…well goodbye µTorrent

Read full topic

item.title: How To Increase Torrent Speed?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I don’t recommend uTorrent, they sold out to RIAA friendly Bittorrent and the client is staying closed source. What does that mean? Potentially they could put some code in there that reports you to RIAA or a government agency if you are downloading illegal torrents, and you wouldn’t be able to tell because it is closed source. Your best bet it to stick with open source bittorrent clients to be 100% sure of your safety.

I recommend:

Azureus (Java, cross-platform)
KTorrent (Linux, KDE)

Read full topic

item.title: How To Increase Torrent Speed?
item.dc:creator: @Hiaburi Hiaburi
item.description:
@Hiaburi wrote:

if you turned off upload, that can slow you down for some reason, and yea the client makes a diference. i recomend utorrent, and heres a link to one with 400+ seeders lol http://isohunt.com/download/18749439/ms+office

Read full topic

In a world without walls and fences, who needs windows and gates?
[/quote]

item.title: How To Increase Torrent Speed?
item.dc:creator: @regecks1 regecks`
item.description:
@regecks1 wrote:

I'm downloading MS Office because I need Word for my coursework
Fale. All you have to do is say that you don't have Office, nor want to spend $500 on it, and some schools or whatever have MSDN Subscriptions -> you should get a free copy of Office Academic, or at least a concession to use another editing suite.

Read full topic

item.title: How To Increase Torrent Speed?
item.dc:creator: @leader leader
item.description:
@leader wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:12, topic:86202”]Download openoffice.org via http or ftp, I usually get about 650kb/s and it is smaller.

In a world without walls and fences, who needs windows and gates?[/quote]

I was going to tell you to download OpenOffice, but Mopar beat me to it. You should check it out. It looks the same as Microsoft Office, but has some different features.

Mopar, what is your download and upload speed? Who is your internet provider?

Read full topic

item.title: How To Increase Torrent Speed?
item.dc:creator: @Aftermath_961 Aftermath
item.description:
@Aftermath_961 wrote:

It’s not you, it’s them.

Not all seeders seed at the maximum possible speed. I limit my total upload, for example.

Find one with a lot of seeders and leechers, that way you’ll get better speed.

Read full topic
